word:
Ownership Aids Poor to Gain Self-respect.--The sense of being owners of their own homes would inspire them [the poor] with a strong desire for improvement. 


                                                     259 

They would soon acquire skill in planning and devising for themselves; their children would be educated to habits of industry and economy, and the intellect would be greatly strengthened. They would feel that they are men, not slaves, and would be able to regain to a great degree their lost self-respect and moral independence.--HS 165, 166, 1886. (AH 373.)
